snippet: A panel of federal judges has rejected a lawsuit claiming Republicans illegally gerrymandered boundaries for seats in Virginia’s House of Delegates to pack black voters into fewer districts.
lead_paragraph: A panel of federal judges has rejected a lawsuit claiming Republicans illegally gerrymandered boundaries for seats in Virginia’s House of Delegates to pack black voters into fewer districts.

headline.print_headline: Virginia: Judge Rules For G.O.P. In a Gerrymandering Case
headline.main: Virginia: Judge Rules for G.O.P. In a Gerrymandering Case
